story:
Liebling, it's time for a tale to drift you off to sleep. Here's a story just for you, mein Schatz:

In a small village nestled in the rolling hills of the Bavarian Alps, there was a little Schneek√∂nigin, a queen of snow, named Lisl. She lived in a cozy little cottage with her Mama and Papa, surrounded by the sounds of the forest and the smell of freshly baked bread.

Every winter, Lisl loved to play in the snow, building snowmen and snowflakes, and making snowangels in the courtyard of her little village. But as the days grew warmer and the sun shone brighter, Lisl noticed that the snow began to melt, and her winter wonderland was fading away.

She was so sad to see her beloved snow disappear that she went to the wise old Elf, Alberich, who lived in a hollow tree in the forest. "Why does the snow go away, Alberich?" she asked, her blue eyes twinkling with tears.

Alberich smiled kindly and said, "Ah, Lisl, the snow is like a special gift from the sky. It brings joy and magic to the world, but it must return to the clouds to make room for the sunshine and greenery of spring. But don't worry, my dear, for I'll help you make the most of these fleeting winter days."

And so, Lisl and Alberich spent their days creating the most marvelous winter wonders. They built an entire snowcastle, with towers and turrets, and even created a snow-slide that went all the way down the mountain. They had snowball fights and made snow-cones, and Lisl even made her first snowman, a jolly fellow named Schneemann, who became her best friend.

As the days passed, Lisl learned that even though the snow would eventually melt, the memories and magic of winter would stay with her forever. And when the sun shone brightly, she knew that the snow would return again, bringing new wonder and enchantment to the village and the sky.

Just like Lisl, mein Schatz, you too can make the most of each season, finding joy and magic in every moment. And when the snow melts and the flowers bloom, remember that the memories and wonder of winter will always be with you, like a warm hug on a cold day.

Schlaf gut, mein Schatz. May your dreams be sweet and your heart be filled with the magic of the snow.
